heading: Job search on the Jobs4Ukraine platform
summary: Jobs4Ukraine will support people affected by the war in Ukraine to rebuild their financial stability through easy access to job opportunities abroad and remote via a free platform.

heading: Free services offered to Ukrainian citizens for their integration into the Romanian labour market
summary: Looking for a job? Safely. Legal. For free. The National Agency for Employment, through its territorial structures, offers several free services to Ukrainian citizens registered with the NAE. Employment Guide from the National Employment Agency of Romania The employment agency's guide provides information on how to look for a job in Romania, including advice on creating a resume, preparing for interviews, and the rules for completing documents for work in this country. Guidance on access to the labor market This guide is intended for migrants and temporary protected persons who want to access the labor market in Romania. It offers a thorough introduction to the Romanian employment system, providing important resources as well as an understanding of the legal aspects for finding a job. The guide was created as part of the project "CDMiR 4 Ukraine: Raising awareness of human rights and equal treatment of Ukrainian refugees in Romania." Organizations Providing Support in Employment for Refugees UNHCR in Romania has compiled a list of organizations ready to assist refugees in the process of employment and integration into the job market. If you need assistance with employment, resume writing, consultations on labor rights and legislation, and other aspects, you can find the full list of these organizations at the following link.
